DataElement.preferredName: Planned Brain Radiation Therapy With Concurrent Temozolomide Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes/No indicator to specify whether the patient is planning to receive brain RT, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide chemotherapy as per standard of care therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Planned Brain Radiation Therapy With Concurrent Temozolomide Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design._An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Occurring or operating at the same time._A triazene analog of dacarbazine with antineoplastic activity.  As a cytotoxic alkylating agent, temozolomide is converted at physiologic pH to the short-lived active compound, monomethyl triazeno imidazole carboxamide (MTIC). The cytotoxicity of MTIC is due primarily to methylation of DNA at the O6 and N7 positions of guanine, resulting in inhibition of DNA replication. Unlike dacarbazine, which is metabolized to MITC only in the liver, temozolomide is metabolized to MITC at all sites. Temozolomide is administered orally and penetrates well into the central nervous system. (NCI04)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.:An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:Occurring or operating at the same time.:A triazene analog of dacarbazine with antineoplastic activity.  As a cytotoxic alkylating agent, temozolomide is converted at physiologic pH to the short-lived active compound, monomethyl triazeno imidazole carboxamide (MTIC). The cytotoxicity of MTIC is due primarily to methylation of DNA at the O6 and N7 positions of guanine, resulting in inhibition of DNA replication. Unlike dacarbazine, which is metabolized to MITC only in the liver, temozolomide is metabolized to MITC at all sites. Temozolomide is administered orally and penetrates well into the central nervous system. (NCI04):The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Occurring or operating at the same time.

A triazene analog of dacarbazine with antineoplastic activity.  As a cytotoxic alkylating agent, temozolomide is converted at physiologic pH to the short-lived active compound, monomethyl triazeno imidazole carboxamide (MTIC). The cytotoxicity of MTIC is due primarily to methylation of DNA at the O6 and N7 positions of guanine, resulting in inhibition of DNA replication. Unlike dacarbazine, which is metabolized to MITC only in the liver, temozolomide is metabolized to MITC at all sites. Temozolomide is administered orally and penetrates well into the central nervous system. (NCI04)
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient planning to receive b
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient planning to receive brain RT, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide chemotherapy as per standard of care therapy.

ReferenceDocuments.name: v2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient planning to receive brain RT, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide chemotherapy as per standard of care therapy. Use of the Tumor Treating Fields (TTFields or Optune(R)) device is allowed after the Month 1 Post RT (10 wk) Neurocognitive-PRO assessment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: v3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient planning to receive brain RT, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide chemotherapy as per standard of care therapy. Use of the Optune® (also known as Tumor Treating Fields or TTFields) device is allowed at provider discretion, but must begin after the Month 1 Post RT (10 wk) Neurocognitive-PRO assessment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: v4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient planning to receive brain RT, and concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide chemotherapy for 6 weeks as per standard of care therapy. Use of the Optune® (also known as Tumor Treating Fields or TTFields) device is allowed at provider discretion, but must begin after the Month 1 Post RT (10 wk) Neurocognitive-PRO assessment
